title: electronicash
author: electronicash
content: Earn KYC-free sats for selling things you don't need. No signup or login. No bank accounts or PayPal.Payment escrow and refundable listing deposits keep buyers and sellers honest.Access the lowest prices on the internet buying from sellers who value sats over fiat.SatsCrap is a marketplace where sats unlock the lowest prices on the internet. It's created by the Scarce City team to extend the functionality of our marketplace beyond Fine Bitcoin Goods. At SatsCrap, buyers are rewarded for their sats with the lowest prices on all types of physical goods while sellers stack sats for selling things they don't need.Sats also act as collateral to minimize fraud and maximize privacy. Users pay a refundable listing deposit in bitcoin to list their item for sale. They can cancel the listing at any time prior to sale to be refunded their deposit immediately. When their item sells, they receive their listing deposit except under the following conditions:If you have more detailed questions, check out our FAQs and if you don't find what you're looking for, email us at chris @ scarce.city.More https://satscrap.com/-------this is no mine but i just want to make it known to everyone here that there is a marketplace for your scraps. i rarely see projects like this one anymore for people to buy and sell things for BTC.i haven't tired this myself but if anyone or wanna try it, please provide a review. you think can we trust them as escrow?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: electronicash on December 03, 2022, 04:06:38 PMyou think can we trust them as escrow?Escrows must have good standing/reputation before I trust them. The marketplace is pretty new in the game and just started building their reputation so if we're talking about playing it safe, I'd say not yet, at least not with significant items/amounts.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Why they require a 10% of product value to be deposited in bitcoin when I want to lise an item? Is it for avoiding fake listing or it's their escrow fee? I don't know how such escrow based marketplace works, I have never used any. However, requiring such a deposit doesn't interest me to list anything there. I was checking and trying to list an item for my country but step down when I saw ot requires an initial deposit.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Making a deposit before you make an advertisement is suspicious behavior, and I do not expect that you will grow in the number of users with this strategy, given that many other options are available.The most important aspect of such services is the activity of the people who advertise and the advertisers who will buy, the use of the guarantee is not essential as long as the evaluation system, trust, user comments work efficiently.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: December 06, 2022, 03:38:32 AMLast edit: December 06, 2022, 01:28:57 PM by PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on December 04, 2022, 05:41:05 AMWhy they require a 10% of product value to be deposited in bitcoin when I want to lise an item? Is it for avoiding fake listing or it's their escrow fee? IProbably for service charge or transaction fee, but asking deposits first is suspicious even though it is refundable. No reputed marketplace as of today did this kind of fees/charge, especially not for a marketplace who currently trying to build a name or building their reputation.Edit: I tried to read their FAQ, and i guess the 10% deposit is misinterpreted for deposit. It is a service fee, 10% fee minus to your entered price in their, you don't need to deposit first but, once a buyer bought an item with a complete transaction, you will receive 10% minus of your product price.Quote from: Little Mouse on December 06, 2022, 01:24:03 PMI think you have misunderstood that. They require a deposit at the beginning of the listing. I have checked them.Oooff, yeah, that's right.

comments.body: Quote from: electronicash on December 03, 2022, 04:06:38 PMi haven't tired this myself but if anyone or wanna try it, please provide a review. you think can we trust them as escrow?I don't trust anyone by default and I don't know who are the people behind Satscrap, other than saying they are some Scarce City team.It's not that I don't like the idea of having marketplace we can use to buy and sell stuff with Bitcoin, but I am careful with any new websites that is released in public.There isn't any search field on website and I didn't notice any item I would buy, so I can't test them right now, but I will keep my eye on this and bookmark it.
